ext_description.p: Probability is mapped to representation, with the probability_value being given through a representation_item which in turn uses a measure_value to hold the value.

In the case of a Probability_derived, the list of Parameters is provided through a second representation_item, which is structured as a tree, the root and first level nodes of which are compound_representation_items. The root item is used to provide the list of Parameters so each first level node represents a single Paramater. This is a compound_representation_item which provides a list of the attributes (paramater_value and parameter_role), each of which is a value_representation_item and uses measure_value to hold the attribute.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: Represents a probability given by verbal description.
This represents a probability given by a numerical value.
This represents a derived probability given by a numerical value, and links it to the parameters used to derive it.
This defines a representation item for a parameter for derived probability.
